column4: can someone please help me.  i'm getting an input/output error when i try to copy files from my external mp3 player.
here is an example of what it says.  cp: reading `Dubwise & Otherwise 2/Gregory Isaacs - Slave Master.mp3': Input/output error
when you plugged in the mp3 player, it should appear on the desktop
should be.  it auto mounts when i plug it in.  i can browse the file system & see everything that's there.  nothing looks out of the ordinary.
i see... , do a cat /etc/mtab and see if it appears there
i don't know what file system is on there.  it runs on linux though.
sudo fdisk -l  should output all disks connected to the motherboard, there your device's filesystem should appear
filesystem should be mounted as vfat then
yep, does it show up while connected in /etc/mtab ?
does this happen only in ubuntu, have you tried connecting it to windows box or other OS ?
yea.  it says vfat in there.  /dev/sdb1 /media/AV404 vfat rw,nosuid,nodev,shortname=mixed,uid=1000,utf8,umask=077,usefree 0 0
mmm seems fine with the rw option, that should let you write fine , is this USB ? try another USB if it is
